title: 4 Simple Ways to Clear History in Safari on Desktop or Mobile

steps.title: Open Safari.
steps.content: Open Safari. You can quickly delete all of your browsing history using this method. If you want to delete a single entry, see the next section instead.

steps.title: Click History.
steps.content: Click History . You can find this in the top toolbar. [1] X Research source If you're using an older version of Safari or Mac, you may need to click Safari instead.

steps.title: Click Clear History….
steps.content: Click Clear History… . This is at the bottom of the drop-down menu. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Click the drop-down menu and select all history.
steps.content: Click the drop-down menu and select all history . If you'd rather delete all history within a certain time frame, select the last hour , today , or today and yesterday instead. Deleting your history will also delete your cookies, cache , and other website data.

steps.title: Click Clear History to confirm.
steps.content: Click Clear History to confirm. All of the history, cookies, searches, and other data from the range you selected will be deleted. Note that this will delete history across all devices connected to your iCloud account if Safari is synced.

steps.title: Open Safari.
steps.content: Open Safari. Use this method to delete select websites from your history.

steps.title: Click History.
steps.content: Click History . This is the tab in the top toolbar. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Click Show All History.
steps.content: Click Show All History . This is the option at the top. You can also press CMD + Y to open this window.

steps.title: Find the entry that you want to delete.
steps.content: Find the entry that you want to delete. You can use the search bar in the upper-right corner, or expand the dates to browse through all your entries.

steps.title: Right-click
steps.content: Right-click on the entry you want to remove and select Delete . If you have a single-button mouse or trackpad, hold Control and click to open the menu. Repeat for any additional entries you want to remove.

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. If you want to delete all of your browsing history, you'll need to do it from the Settings app instead of Safari. If you want to delete a single entry, skip to the next section .

steps.title: Tap Apps.
steps.content: Tap Apps . If you're using iOS 17 or older, skip this step. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Safari.
steps.content: Tap Safari . You'll see this in the list of apps.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Clear History and Website Data.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Clear History and Website Data . This is near the bottom of the page.

steps.title: Select All history.
steps.content: Select All history . If you'd rather delete all history within a certain time frame, select Last hour , Today , or Today and yesterday .

steps.title: Tap Clear History.
steps.content: Tap Clear History . This is the red button. All of your history, cookies, and other browsing information will be deleted.

steps.title: Open the Safari app on your device.
steps.content: Open the Safari app on your device. If you just want to get rid of a couple of entries, you can delete individual history entries from within the Safari app.

steps.title: Tap the "Bookmarks" button at the bottom of the screen.
steps.content: Tap the "Bookmarks" button at the bottom of the screen. It looks like an open book.

steps.title: Select "History" from the Bookmarks menu.
steps.content: Select "History" from the Bookmarks menu. This is the tab with the clock icon. You may already be on this tab.

steps.title: Find the history entry that you want to remove and swipe it to the left.
steps.content: Find the history entry that you want to remove and swipe it to the left. This will reveal the "Delete" button.

steps.title: Tap Delete to remove the entry.
steps.content: Tap Delete to remove the entry. Repeat this for any other history entries you want to delete. When you're finished, tap Done in the top-right corner.
